questions.question: What does isotropic antenna gain pattern mean?

answers.a: The power gain term at the antenna DOES NOT depend on the angle of arrival of the signal
answers.b: The power gain term at the antenna DOES NOT depend on the phase of the received signal

explanations.a: Correct. Isotropic antennas radiate or receive power equally in all directions, so gain is independent of the angle of arrival.
explanations.b: Incorrect. Phase is not directly related to antenna gain pattern.
explanations.c: Incorrect. Only option (a) is valid for isotropic pattern.

questions.question: If a channel has a complex Gaussian gain term, i.e., the received signal is y = Hx + w, and all the entries of the H matrix are complex Gaussian, then select the correct option

answers.a: The magnitude of the received signal gain is Rayleigh distributed and the phase is Gaussian distributed
answers.b: The magnitude of the received signal gain is Chi-square distributed with no. of degrees of freedom equal to the rank of the H matrix and the phase is uniformly distributed in [0, 2π]
answers.c: The magnitude of the received signal gain is Rayleigh distributed and the phase is uniformly distributed in [0, 2π]
answers.d: The magnitude of the received signal gain is Chi-square distributed with no. of degrees of freedom equal to the rank of the H matrix and the phase is Gaussian distributed

explanations.a: Incorrect. The phase is not Gaussian distributed.
explanations.b: Incorrect. The gain of a single complex Gaussian channel is Rayleigh, not Chi-square.
explanations.c: Correct. For complex Gaussian variables, magnitude is Rayleigh distributed and phase is uniformly distributed in [0, 2π].
explanations.d: Incorrect. The phase is uniformly distributed, not Gaussian.

questions.question: What is the relation between the auto-correlation of a random signal and its power spectral density?

answers.a: The auto-correlation is the Fourier transform of the power spectral density
answers.b: The power spectral density is the Fourier transform of the auto-correlation
answers.c: They are not related in the case of random signals
answers.d: The power spectral density is the Fourier transform of the auto-correlation if and only if the process is Gaussian

explanations.a: Incorrect. This reverses the actual relationship.
explanations.b: Correct. According to the Wiener-Khinchin theorem, the PSD is the Fourier transform of the autocorrelation function.
explanations.c: Incorrect. They are related for wide-sense stationary random processes.
explanations.d: Incorrect. The relationship holds for any wide-sense stationary process, not just Gaussian.
